summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter record documenting the emergency medical response to Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, after he was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM). The document details resuscitation efforts, including CPR, intubation, and medication administration, before he was transported to a local emergency room.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM) on August 10, 2019, who was the subject of the emergency medical resuscitation efforts documented in this record.

connections.description: RN was the healthcare provider documenting and participating in the emergency medical response for inmate Epstein.
MD cosigned the medical documentation related to Epstein's emergency care.
RN authored the medical note which required and received cosignature from an MD.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At approximately 06:35, a body alarm was activated for a medical emergency. Jeffrey Epstein was found on the floor of his cell in the Special Housing Unit, unresponsive, cold, with bruising around the neck and posterior mottling. Correctional officers were performing CPR.

events.title: Emergency Resuscitation Attempt
events.description: A full medical resuscitation code was performed on Epstein, including continuous CPR, placement of an AED (no shock advised), peripheral IV access, endotracheal intubation by paramedics, and administration of epinephrine and sodium bicarbonate. He was transported to a local ER with CPR in progress.

events.title: Medical Documentation Cosigned
events.description: The clinical encounter documentation created by the RN on August 10 was formally cosigned by an MD.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) - Facility where the event occurred, specifically the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and Health Services Unit (HSU) treatment room.
Local ER - The emergency room to which Epstein was transported.
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC New York) on the morning of August 10, 2019, at approximately 06:35.
The clinical note documents specific physical findings upon discovery: Epstein was 'cold, with circumferential bruising around the neck and posterior mottling. Pupils fixed and dilated.'
A full resuscitation effort was undertaken, including CPR, intubation, and cardiac medications, but he was in asystole (no heart rhythm) and was transported to a local hospital with CPR ongoing.
The medical record was created by an RN on August 10, 2019, and was cosigned by an MD two days later on August 12, 2019.
The document is a primary source record of the immediate medical response to the incident that led to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
